oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Commission of James Davis Porter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The commission of James Davis Porter into the Confederate Provisional Army of Tennessee dated May 9, 1861 and signed by Governor Isham G. Harris. Porter served on the staff of Confederate General Benjamin Franklin Cheatham for most of the war. After the Civil War Porter served as governor of Tennessee from 1874 to 1878 and was later president of Peabody College, now part of Vanderbilt University. Porter was born in Paris, Henry County, Tennessee in 1828 and died there in 1912.
